headline: Italian Breaded Pork Chops
description: These breaded pork chops are coated with Italian bread crumbs and Parmesan cheese, then cooked until crisp and golden brown for a delicious dinner.

video.description: See how to make Italian-style baked pork chops.
video.name: Italian Breaded Pork Chops

name: Italian Breaded Pork Chops

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (160 degrees C).
Beat eggs and milk together in a shallow dish.
Mix bread crumbs, Parmesan cheese, and parsley together in a second shallow dish.
Heat oil in a large, oven-proof skillet over medium heat. Stir in garlic and cook until just golden brown to flavor the oil. Remove garlic with a slotted spoon and reserve for another use.
Dip each pork chop into egg mixture, then bread crumb mixture until well coated.
Place pork chops in the skillet and cook until golden and crisp, about 5 minutes on each side.
Transfer the skillet into the preheated oven and bake chops for 25 minutes, or to an internal temperature of 145 degrees F (63 degrees C).

review.reviewBody: Make it as written, my husband and I love it and I make it often.

Cast iron pan. Used 1" pork loins, fresh oregano, crushed garlic and two eggs. Fresh ground Romano and parmesan coarse shredded and less bread crumbs. Just enough to coat lightly. Used vegetable oil to brown at higher temp in cast pan. Leave the garlic in the pan and 400 degrees for 18 minutes in oven. Crusty outside, tender and juicy inside. Served with grilled brussels sprouts, truffle potato smash and Barbera d'Asti wine. Sorry no pics. Pure carnage from wife feral hungry teens.

Excellent! Tender and tasty. I used a meat tenderizer before dipping in the egg , milk. I used my plain bread crumbs, added Italian seasoning, parm cheese, and parsley. The chops were thin cut so only baked 20 minutes.
Nothing more to say, I agree with all the other reviewers.
These were absolutely delicious; & so moist. Thank you for sharing this amazing Recipe. No more Store Brand shake n bake required in my household!
My family loves these pork chops! the are the best ever!

Way, way too much breading and eggs. Also cooked too long. I did like it, though, so I will make it again and add onion, salt, and pepper for starters to punch up the flavor. The cast iron skillet is the way to go, by the way.
My family loved this dish!!! It's requested once a week..

The recipe itself is great in terms of flavor and tenderness of the meat however I followed it exactly and my pork chops were very soggy after the oven. And the breading fell right off (I did the flour tip other reviewers mentioned). The pork chops were crispy prior to the oven. I had to put them back in the stove to get a little crisp but couldn‚Äôt do too long with risk of burning. Next time I‚Äôll put on a rack on a baking tray. Maybe that will be the trick.
Pork chops were so juicy and tender . The flavor was great. Will make again.
It was so delicious and easy,
Great recipebut in my opinion the dry mixture of breadcrumbs cheese and parsley should be decreased. There was a lot of waste. 2 eggs would have been enough as well. The outcome was delicious!
I made it about 1/2 dozen times. Family loves them.
Delicious it's more than worth the time to make.
Pretty good üëç

I love the flavor and tenderness of these pork chops and their crispy outside. They‚Äôre super easy too. I follow the recipe exactly and make no substitutes or alterations. Recipe is perfect the way it is.
AWESOMELY EASY & DELICIOUS...
Easy to prepare and always turn out great. Added paprika in addition to the Italian seasoning for an added boost.
Flavor was decent but still kind of bland. My family wasn't very impressed so probably won't bother making again unless I punch up the seasonings.
The kids loved this recipe

Loved this recipe. I brined my pork chops first in warm water for a minimum of 15 minutes. Adding the parmesan cheese to the bread crumb mixture made this the most tasteful pork chops that I ever made. My sons loved it too, so we'll definitely do this again.

2 eggs for 4 chops was plenty. I also sprinkled the cheese and parsley over a bed of crumbs (mixing it in with a clean fork) individually for each chop. I used a cast iron skillet and browned them for only 2-3 min per side. 25 min in the oven and they were perfectly browned, crispy, and deliciously tender and juicy! Try them, you won't be disappointed.
I made this recipe exactly as instructed and it turnedout great! This is the 2nd time I've made it and will make it again!
Best pork chops I ever ate. Tender and moist. Thank you.

I have made this recipe twice now. The first time I breaded as the recipe states and pan fried then finished in the oven. They were tasty but the breading wasn't crunchy enough for me.
The second time I made them I switched out parmesan for Parmesano reggiano and double dipped (dipped in egg wash then breading then back in egg was and back in breading again) for a thicker crust. Then I pan fried and finished off in my air-fryer toaster oven for a crispier crunchier crust. VERY GOOD!
Easy and delicious

Good basic recipe! Tasty and quick to make. I made the mistake of not frying the chops before baking as a result they came out pale in color. So fry them first and finish in the oven for that crispy, charred flavor. I definitely will be making again.
Thanks for the great recipe! It was wonderful
Great recipe easy to make and I will make it again!
So delicious. Everybody who tried it loved it. It‚Äôs very flavorful, and downright good eats
It's very tasty and easy to make!!!! Ate pretty well also
This recipe always works for me. Pork chops are juicy not dry.
This was delicious!! I coated with flour first as others suggested and added seasoning that we like. They were so tender
I subbed creole seasoning for parsley and did a reverse sear since I don‚Äôt have an oven proof pan. This recipe is a great foundation to build on.
Turned out very well. Prep time is quick and clean up even faster. The leftovers I added lemon zest. We liked that even more.

Nice, I like crispy breaded meats. Went the stovetop rote. Heated garlic salt and onion flakes instead of onion in the oil. I only had plain breadcrumbs so I seasoned my own. Salt, pepper, Italian seasoning, chili powder, dried parsley, a few other things. Mixed it up in a bowl. Came out just fine.
This is my go-to pork chop recipe. Easy to make and the family loves them. I serve with cheesy potatoes, peas and crusty french bread.
new favorite dish and simple to make.
Really Liked it. I used thin cut pork chops. A big hit in our house! Adding it to the normal rotation!

After 10 plus years of trusting high ratings on Allrecipies, I was finally let down. I followed the instructions to the letter. The flavor was just ok. The chops stayed very moist, but kinda tough, like they were over cooked. I would say cut the sear time by half and take at least 5 minutes off the oven time. I doubt I would even try my own suggestion here as I doubt I would ever want to make this again.
A bit bland
awesome recipe!

I only had 2 chops so halved the recipe. Way too much breading so glad I took some out before I put the chops in in. Also only used one egg and that was more than enough so could probably cut that down too. They were pretty good and followed the recipe completely. Flavor was good. Had to add salt and pepper when we ate them. Very easy to make and quick.
In my Opinion: This is my GO-TO recipe for the best Pork Chops Ever!!!
Was good! Used hot honey for a zing
Delicious! Turned out so moist.
I made these last night for dinner. We will be making them again they were great.
I did not have italian seasoning breadcrums, used original, and did not have parsley, used oregano, I liked this very much
I got the thumbs up on this one! Will definitely make this one again.

A tasty way to make chops that are more moist and tender than other methods, without cooking in a sauce or gravy. The coatings (egg/milk and crumbs/parmesan) were more than twice the amount I needed for 4 chops - will reduce significantly next time to avoid waste.

Nice recipe! I will be making it again! One change that I recommend, coat your pork chops in flour before placing in egg/milk mixture. I do this with all my breading recipes. The flour helps the egg/milk adhere better to whatever you are coating and thus heps the breadcrumbs adhere better. Give it a try with batter fried chicken or fish, schnitzel recipes, etc.
Fabulous! Will make again!

Great flavor and tender!
I used garlic powder with the Italian bread crumbs, and grated parmesan cheese. I dipped the chop in the bread crumbs, dipped in egg and than rebatter. 
I baked in the oven at 350¬∞ F for 15 minutes and than turned and baked the 2nd side for 15 minutes. 
Tender and juicy.
I followed some of the suggestions and dredged in flour/salt/pepper, before dipping in egg. I also crushed the garlic instead of chopping. It was very tasty and I will make it again!
The recipe was very good and easy to make. Chops came out very tender and tasty! This is my second time making this recipe and didn't change a thing!
Great flavor and a hit with the family
This recipe was fantastic, I've always love Italian food, an I love cooking, will be making it again.
I made these for my husband on Father‚Äôs Day and he really loved them.

This has a really good flavor. Mine didn't turn out like the picture shows so I will try it again. I agree with the other reviewers that said 3 eggs and 1 cup of breadcrumbs is waaaay too much. Though I only cooked 3 pork chops, I used 1 egg and 1/2 cup breadcrumbs and still had some of each left over. The chops turned out crunchy on the outside but I found the crust came off as soon as I served them. Not sure what I did to make that happen.
A new family favorite. My breaded porkchops never tasted this good
I would not change a thing! Honestly, my husband gave this the highest praise. He literally could not stop raving about how delicious this was.

I made these pork chops last night and my hubby and I devoured them. And my husband does not care for pork chops but he loved these. I used thick-cut boneless chops. I did not change anything in the recipe, with the exception of, I didn't have italian breadcrumbs, so I used plain and added a generous amount of italian seasoning. I also used a bit of panko crumbs, but overall, I used 1 1/2 cups of breadcrumbs. I ended up throwing a lot of the breadcrumbs out. I think 1 1/2 cups was too much. The next time I make this, I will cut down on some of the waste by using only 2 eggs, 2 TBS milk, 3/4 cup breadcrumbs and 1/4 cup parmasean. I'll cut back a bit on the parsley also. I think that will be more than enough to cover 4 porkchops. I will definately be making this again. And it was so easy!
Honestly I did not like these very much. They came out pretty bland and dry. I, myself would give it 2 stars, but my boyfriend liked it so I‚Äôm giving it 3.
I've made this recipe several times I just cut back on the amount of bread crumbs because I was wasting too much.
great
I did flour, egg, breadcrumbs. Delicious!
Oh my gosh this was amazing! I just think it needs some kind of decadent cream sauce to really knock your socks off, but it's still terrific without!

This was absolutely DELICIOUS - crispy and savory outside and tender and juicy inside. My family flipped over it and my hubs said he wanted chops fixed no other way from now on - WOW!
I did have to make a few changes due to a lack of the called for ingredients: made my own bread crumbs from leftover stuffing crusts from the bakery. Used 1 tbsp Italian Seasoning, 2 tsp fennel seed, 2 tsp garlic salt to make the seasoned bread crumbs. I do like the fennel taste in there, by the way.
As I was using cheap chops, I used 1 tbsp. instant meat tenderizer and also rubbed them with the extra seasoning I mixed up. The rest was identical to the recipe. It was easy and so, so good - I'll make this again and again! 
By the way, I served it with buttered rutabaga seasoned with ground nutmeg, green beans with canned whole tomatoes in Italian dressing. Everyone cleaned their plates.
Thanks for sharing your family's recipe!
love this recipe. super easy and the chops were super tender. All I added was some garlic powder. will make again for sure!

I was a little apprehensive because of the few ingredients required, but I was pleasantly surprised! It was easy to prepare and very very flavorful! I wouldn't change a thing about it! Enjoy as we did.

Great recipe!Very easy to follow and the turn out was great. I followed step by step since it was my first time and I think the only thing I would change is flour before egg wash next time. This recipe will definitely make my favorite list. Thank you

Chops had a good flavor. But came out a little dry. I didn't have problems with breading sticking but it was a little too moist for my taste will make again but cover and bake then uncover and broil last few minutes to crisp up the breading.
Delicious chops! They came out tender, juicy and perfect. I made one change, as there wasn't quite enough EVOO, so I added 1 T to the pan.

Worked well. I'll do it again. 
- I used panko instead or regular crumbs with no issue.
- I did 5 chops, so had to do 3 loads of the fry pan, then transferred to a cookie sheet for the baking. Be sure to re-oil your pan between sets of chops!
The poor man's shortcut to the garlic process is to just sprinkle garlic powder in the oil as it heats. Used the leavings to make a gravy.
This was really good for a quick last minute dinner.
This turned out very well. The only thing is I think the chops should have been salted & peppered.
Great, easy recipe. I used thin sliced pork chops. Even my picky kids liked it :) I will definitely make again!

The next time I will only use 1 cup of bread crumbs. I had a lot left over after coating the 4 pork chops. I will also sprinkle a little Parmesan on the pork chops when they are fresh out of the oven . The recipe was really good and I will try it again!
excellent! thank you!
We found them to be a bit bland. I think they could have benefited from a little seasoning before breading. Will try again and bake them on an oven rack to make them a little crispier.
I didn't need all these ingredients for just 4 chops--cut it back so as not to waste ingredients.

Really good! I had 1.5 lbs of boneless pork chops. Pounded them thin. Used only 1 egg, 1/2 cup Italian bread crumbs, 1/2 cup parmesan, 1/2 tsp garlic powder. I pan fried them, flipping often. Only took a few minutes to cook since they were thin. It's a keeper!

Very simple indeed, agree on a few others that 2 min each side is enough, also if you prefer juicier chops transfer to a baking pan instead of skillet (I cooked two in skillet and two in a baking dish).
Delicious!!! Well worth the effort. Used my cast iron pans they came out moist on the inside and crusty on the outside!
Super easy to make. Not sure what to do with the roasted garlic after I made it, but the recipe was tasty and the pork chops were juicy.
Very bland. I should of read the reviews and added a lot of seasonings.

I thought I did something wrong the first two times, so I tried again and followed the recipe perfectly and I'm still disappointed. The only good thing I can say about it is at least its somewhat edible. 

Chops came out soggy, flavorless and tough. Sprinkled salt on it after cooking so I could get it down. 

After this third attempt, I learned the problem wasn't me. I won't be making again.
Delicious! 325 in the oven let it get a little soggy. I tried 400 and it‚Äôs perfect n crispy!

Pork chops were very tasty and moist. This is second time I made them with a couple of changes. Also added 1 tablespoon of brown sugar and slightly less than a teaspoon of cayenne pepper. I do not fry pork chops before baking. Baked pork chops for 30 minutes covered with foil, then 20 minutes without the foil. Delicious!

These were so good! My 6 year old son was raving about the smell as they were cooking and they did not disappoint! I made a few small changes. I only had 2 bone-in chops, so I halved the majority of the recipe. I used Italian flavored panko bread crumbs and added both grated and shredded Parmesan cheese. I also added a little bit of Italian Seasoning and garlic salt. I accidentally cooked the chops a little less than the 5 mins on each side and only removed some of the garlic from the pan (I used pre-minced), but I added 5 minutes to the bake time. They were crispy, moist, and juicy...and SO EASY! This one is a winner.
it was the best thing i ever tasted
Excellent dish. everybody loved the meal, this is a solid choice for dinner.
Not sure if anyone else was confused about what to do with the reserve garlic after cooking? I decided to add it to the bread crumb mix. It turned out to be a great choice.
So easy and so delicious. You can easily cut the dredging down to 1 egg and 1/2 cup bread crumbs and 1/4 cup parmesan. For 4 chops the recipe is way too much.
The pork chops had no flavor it needs way more seasoning bread crumbs and cheese aren‚Äôt enough.
It was great but what was the point of the garlic, just to flavor the oil??
My family thought the chops should have been pounded flat to tenderize for this recipe.
Delicious! Followed the instructions exactly and it was so tasty.
Followed recipe as well as the suggestions from others-tender and easy to make but not much flavor. Resembled a recipe I made in my single days. No real plans to make it again
